channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Trump's base in North Carolina divided over Robinson controversy
item.description: Trump supporters at a Wilmington rally were optimistic about his chances in North Carolina but divided over Lt. Gov. Mark Robinson's recent scandal involving past controversial comments. While some dismissed the allegations as media attacks, others expressed concern over their impact on his campaign. Many still supported Robinson for his political stance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Gretchen Whitmer calls Trump 'deranged' over his abortion remarks
item.description: Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer criticized former President Donald Trump during a CNN interview, calling him 'deranged' for his recent comments on abortion. Trump claimed that women would be happier and healthier if he were re-elected. Whitmer argued that Trump does not understand the daily challenges faced by women in America.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Usher deletes all his X posts after 'wild things' claim about Diddy: 'Hacked or damage control?'
item.description: ​With Diddy going down, several pop stars are now at stake with their previous involvement with Diddy. Reports claimed Justin Bieber was also a victim of Diddy's sexual assault. An X user shared the video in question in which a relatively young Justin appears alongside the rapper as the two speak about Justin not staying in touch with him. The user wrote in his post, “A video of Diddy having 15yo justin bieber stuttering when he asked why they don’t hang out no more is resurfacing online (sic)”.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: '5 petals of 'PUSHP' will make Viksit Bharat': PM Modi tells Indian diaspora in New York
item.description: The Indian diaspora in Delaware is excited about Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit. They see themselves as cultural ambassadors of India. In his address, Modi emphasized unity, pride, and optimism while praising the diaspora's role in strengthening US-India relations. He also discussed India's recent elections and his vision for a developed India.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: 'We all know...': Melania Trump snubbed for her Christmas Ornament series
item.description: Melania is very much present everywhere apart from her husband's election campaign. She is releasing teasers for her upcoming memoir speaking about Donald Trump, their son Barron, her past profession of a fashion model where she shot nude photos as well. But the Christmas ornaments did not go down well with the social media users who commented, “We all know what you REALLY think about Christmas."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: GOP senator Lindsey Graham says 'porn site' charges against Mark Robinson beyond unnerving but...
item.description: North Carolina Lt Gov Mark Robinson is accused of making offensive online comments, which he denies. GOP Senator Lindsey Graham finds the charges unnerving and suggests legal action if untrue. Prominent Republicans urge Robinson to prove his innocence, while Democrats criticize his connection to Donald Trump. “Mark Robinson could not exist without the support of Donald Trump,” North Carolina Attorney General Josh Stein said
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Final debate showdown: Will Trump let Vance take the spotlight?
item.description: JD Vance and Tim Walz, running mates for Donald Trump and Kamala Harris respectively, are scheduled to debate on October 1. This will be the sole vice presidential debate of the campaign season. Speculations are emerging about whether Trump wants Vance or himself to participate in a final debate before early voting begins.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tulsi Gabbard recalls when she was told 'how dare you meet Donald Trump' in 2016
item.description: Tulsi Gabbard recalled when she first met Donald Trump in 2016 as a Democratic leader two weeks after his election even before his swearing in. She said she was criticized by her party for meeting Donald Trump because the Democratic Party and the mainstream media demonize Donald Trump, making him look like a Hitler-like caricature.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Police officer dies in Pakistan blast during foreign diplomats' security operation
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'This isn't real Oprah...': Trump hate-reviews interview, says Kamala looked really...
item.description: At his campaign rally in Wilmington, North Carolina, Trump asked the crowd whether they watched the Oprah interview. "“That’s not gonna be president, and Oprah didn’t know what the hell to do. Oprah was like embarrassed. She wanted to hide under the table, but she’s a professional, and she was able to sort of disguise it," Trump said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kate Middleton makes first public appearance since announcing completion of her chemotherapy treatment
item.description: The Princess of Wales, Kate Middleton, appeared publicly for the first time since finishing chemotherapy. Joined by Prince William and other royals at Crathie Kirk Church in Balmoral, she looked healthy. Recently chairing an early years initiative meeting, Kate shared a video on her recovery and upcoming public engagements.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Coldplay India concert 2025: BookMyShow crashes minutes before tickets go live; IRCTC and other memes flood internet
item.description: Thousands of fans faced frustration as BookMyShow crashed just before Coldplay concert tickets went on sale. The British band will perform in Mumbai's DY Patil Stadium in January 2025, marking their return to India after eight years. An additional show has been added due to high demand despite the technical issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI Tech Desk

item.title: Netanyahu says Israel 'landed series of blows on Hezbollah'; vows zero tolerance for attacks
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared that Israel had dealt significant blows to Hezbollah following intense cross-border fire. Defence Minister Yoav Gallant reiterated the military's aim to ensure the safe return of displaced northern Israeli residents. The Israeli military reported over 150 rockets and drones targeting their territory, primarily from Lebanon.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pollster Nate Silver says people should be making contingency plans for Trump win
item.description: ​Silver's model correctly predicted the results of the 2008, 2012 and the 2020 elections but about 2024, he said it's still a "toss-up". According to his 2024 model, Harris retains a modest lead in the probability of winning the election and the popular vote, as well as a 63 percent probability of winning swing state Michigan and a 57 percent chance of taking the crucial state of Pennsylvania.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: RFK Jr's wife takes off wedding ring amid 'obsessed' Olivia Nuzzi sexting, nude pics row?
item.description: ​Nuzzi was reportedly obsessed with Kennedy Jr after interviewing him. Nuzzi reportedly pursued him to such a point that Kennedy had to block her. “She targeted him pretty hard. Bobby was blocking her continually. It was a little scary. She was obsessed with him. I think she still is," the report said adding that those close to Nuzzi did not agree with this allegation that Nuzzi was the aggressor.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Building collapse in Naples kills two siblings, leaving their mother and an older woman trapped
Pope condemns killing of Honduran environmental activist
Princess Kate shines as most beloved royal, but poll shows Harry and Meghan’s popularity dips
item.description: Kate, Princess of Wales, tops an Ipsos poll as the most beloved British royal with a 66% favorability rating. Prince William and Princess Anne follow closely in popularity. King Charles maintains a solid 56% approval despite health challenges. In contrast, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have significantly lower ratings.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 300-kilo WWI bomb removed in Belgrade
item.description: A century-old artillery round weighing nearly 300 kilogrammes (660 pounds), was safely removed on Sunday from a construction site near the Serbian Parliament in Belgrade, police said. In Nis, southern Serbia, a large bomb from the 1999 NATO bombing was discovered in April, while in 2021, a 242-kilogramme bomb from WWII was removed from a construction site in a Belgrade suburb.

item.title: Israeli forces raid Al Jazeera office in West Bank, order 45-day closure
